System.out.println("Error: Alert amount must be a positive number.");

assert totalExpenses >= 0 : "Total expenses cannot be negative";

* Represents a Budget that tracks expenses within a specific category.
* The budget can have an optional spending limit.
* Constructs a Budget object with the given category and spending limit.
* @param category The name of the budget category (e.g., "Food", "Transport").
* @param limit The spending limit for the budget.
* Adds an expense to the list of expenses for this budget.
* @param expense The expense to add to this budget.
* Calculates the total amount of all expenses in this budget.
* @return The total expenses for the budget.
* Sets a new spending limit for this budget.
* @param amount The new spending limit for this budget.
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Budget limit cannot be negative.");
* Gets the spending limit of this budget.
* @return The current spending limit for this budget.
* Prints all expenses under this budget in reverse order (most recent first).
public void deleteExpense(int index) throws InvalidInputException {
throw new InvalidInputException("Invalid index. Please provide a valid expense number.");
* The BudgetManager class is responsible for managing multiple budgets.
* It allows tracking expenses and setting alerts when expenses exceed a threshold.
* Constructs a BudgetManager with an initial "Monthly" budget.
* The "Monthly" budget is created with a default limit of 0.
this.alert = new Alert(); // Initialise alert system
assert budgets != null : "Budgets HashMap should be initialized.";
assert alert != null : "Alert system should be initialized.";
* Adds an expense to a specified budget category.
* Always adds to the "Monthly" budget. If a valid category exists, it is added there too;
* otherwise, a prompt is shown to create the category.
* Also checks if total expenses exceed the budget alert threshold.
* @param category    The budget category (e.g., "Food"), or empty for "Monthly".
* @param description A brief description of the expense.
public void addExpenseToBudget(String category, double amount, String description) {
assert amount > 0 : "Error: Expense amount should be positive.";
logger.warning("Monthly budget was missing. Initialized a new Monthly budget.");
assert budgets.get("Monthly") != null : "Monthly budget should be initialized.";
System.out.println("Budget category '" + category + "' not found. Added to Monthly Budget.");
logger.warning("Budget category '" + category + "' not found. Added to Monthly Budget.");
* Sets a budget alert at the specified amount.
* If total expenses exceed this limit, a notification will be triggered.
* @param amount The alert threshold. If 0, the alert is removed.
assert amount >= 0 : "Error: Budget amount should not be negative.";
* Checks if total expenses exceed the alert limit.
alert.checkAlert(totalExpenses); // Alert system will notify if limit is exceeded
* Retrieves all budgets managed by BudgetManager.
* @return A map of budget categories and their corresponding Budget objects.
* Sets the budget for a given category or the "Monthly" budget if no category is specified.
* Creates a new budget if the category does not exist, otherwise updates its limit.
* @param category The budget category (e.g., "Food"), or empty for "Monthly".
* @param amount   The budget limit to set.
public void setBudget(String category, double amount) {
assert amount >= 0 : "Error: Budget amount should not be negative.";
logger.info("Created new budget category: " + category + " with limit $" + amount);
logger.info("Updated budget for category " + category + " to: $" + amount);
System.out.println("Budget for category " + category + " set to: $" + amount);
* Calculates the total expenses across all budgets.
* Displays all expenses categorized under Monthly budget.
assert budgets.containsKey("Monthly") : "Error: 'Monthly' budget should exist before listing expenses.";
* Deletes an expense from the Monthly Budget based on index.
* @param index The index of the expense to delete.
public void deleteExpense(int index) throws InvalidInputException {
assert index >= 0 : "Expense index should not be negative.";
throw new InvalidInputException("No Monthly budget found.");
logger.info("Expense at index " + index + " deleted from Monthly Budget.");
* Displays the budget allocation, amount spent, and remaining balance.
* If a category is specified, it shows details for that category.
* Otherwise, it shows the overall budget usage for the current month.
* @param category The budget category (e.g., "Food"), or empty for "Monthly".
assert monthlyBudget != null : "Error: 'Monthly' budget should always exist.";
assert budgets.get(category) != null : "Category budget should exist when checking.";
* This class summarizes the user budget by providing total expenses and spending limit.
* This can summarize across multiple budgets.
* Instantiate the class with a BudgetManager to access its private variable "budgets".
* @param budgetManager is taken in the Duke class (main class).
* This is the method called to get the summary printed.
Map<String, Budget> budgets = budgetManager.getBudgets(); // Access the budgets map
* Main entry-point for the java.duke.Duke application.
* Represents an expense with an amount, description, and timestamp.
protected static final DateTimeFormatter DATETIME_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("E, MMM dd 'at' HH:mm");
* Creates a new Expense with a specified amount and description.
* The timestamp is automatically set to the current date and time.
* @param amount      The amount spent. Must be non-negative.
* @param description The description of the expense. Cannot be null.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the description is null or the amount is negative.
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Description cannot be empty.");
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Amount cannot be negative.");
assert dateTime != null : "DateTime should be initialized properly.";
* Returns a string representation of the expense, including the amount and timestamp.
* The amount is formatted as currency, and the timestamp follows the predefined format.
* @return A formatted string representing the expense.
return formattedAmount + " spent on " + description + " (" + formattedDateTime + ")";
* The InputManager class handles user input, processes commands, and interacts with the BudgetManager.
* It continuously listens for input until the "bye" command is entered, and processes commands to
* add expenses to budgets or handle invalid input.
* Constructs an InputManager that interacts with the specified BudgetManager.
* @param budgetManager The BudgetManager instance to be used for managing budgets and expenses.
assert budgetManager != null : "BudgetManager cannot be null.";
* Starts an input processing loop where the user can enter commands.
* The loop continues until the user types "bye".
throw new InvalidInputException("Please try again with one of the valid commands:" +
"\nadd, alert, summary, list, delete, set-budget, bye");
System.out.println("Invalid input: Please enter a valid number.");
* Parses an "add" command to extract the amount, category, and description.
* @return A string array containing [amount, category, description].
* @throws InvalidInputException If the format is incorrect.
throw new InvalidInputException("Please use the format: add <AMOUNT> c/ <CATEGORY> d/ <DESCRIPTION>");
throw new InvalidInputException("Please use the format: add <AMOUNT> c/ <CATEGORY> d/ <DESCRIPTION>");
// Split by "/d" to separate Category and Description
throw new InvalidInputException("Please use the format: add <AMOUNT> c/ <CATEGORY> d/ <DESCRIPTION>");
* Parses a "set-budget" command to extract the budget category and amount.
* @throws InvalidInputException If the format is incorrect.
public String[] parseSetBudgetCommand(String command) throws InvalidInputException {
throw new InvalidInputException("Invalid command format. Use set-budget c/CATEGORY AMOUNT");
} else if (parts.length == 3 && parts[1].startsWith("c/")) { // Category budget setting
throw new InvalidInputException("Invalid command format. Use set-budget c/CATEGORY AMOUNT");
throw new InvalidInputException("Invalid amount format. Please enter a valid number.");
* Parses an "alert" command to extract the alert amount.
* @return The alert amount as a double.
* @throws InvalidInputException If the format is incorrect.
public double parseAlertCommand(String command) throws InvalidInputException {
throw new InvalidInputException("Please use the format: alert <AMOUNT>");
* Parses a "delete" command to extract the expense index to be deleted.
* @return The index of the expense to delete.
* @throws InvalidInputException If the format is incorrect.
public int parseDeleteCommand(String command) throws InvalidInputException {
throw new InvalidInputException("Please use the format: delete <INDEX>");
* Parses the "check-budget" command to extract the category (if provided).
* @return The extracted category or an empty string if not provided.
* @throws InvalidInputException If the format is incorrect.
public String parseCheckBudgetCommand(String command) throws InvalidInputException {
return ""; // No category provided, check overall budget
throw new InvalidInputException("Invalid format. Use: check-budget [c/CATEGORY]");
